revision.text:
{{Infobox person | name = Matt Meese | image = | alt = | caption = | birth_name = Matthew Ryan Meese | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1983|10|10}} | birth_place = [[New Jersey]] | education = [[Brigham Young University]] | occupation = Actor, sketch comedian, screenwriter | website = |}} '''Matt Meese''' (born October 10, 1983){{Cite web|url=http://www.ageeyehaircolor.com/matthew-meese/|access-date=2016-12-07}} is a sketch comedian and actor who is best known for his prominent role as actor, head writer, and co-creator of ''[[Studio C]]'', a popular comedy show on both [[BYUtv]] and [[YouTube]]. ==Early life and education== Meese was born in [[New Jersey]] and raised in [[Phoenix, Arizona]], a home he was fond of, as the second of four children.{{Cite web|url=http://mormonartist.net/interviews/matt-meese/|title=Matt Meese — Mormon Artist|website=mormonartist.net|access-date=2016-11-29}} He has claimed that his greatest achievement to date is having a proud mother.{{Cite news|url=http://www.radiogoldproductions.com/thegoodword/studio-c-mallory-everton-matt-meese-interview-episode-2-2/|title=Studio C - Mallory Everton and Matt Meese Interview - Episode 2.2 - The Good Word Podcast|date=2014-01-24|newspaper=The Good Word Podcast|language=en-US|access-date=2016-11-29}} After high school, Meese served as a [[The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints | LDS]] [[Missionary (LDS Church)|missionary]] in [[Chicago]] [[Illinois]], after which he attended and later graduated from [[BYU]] with an undergraduate degree in Psychology. Before and after his college graduation, he worked for the [[Monte L. Bean Life Science Museum]] for a total of 5 years.{{cite web|last1=Klemetson|first1=Rebecca|title=Matt Meese: Living a life of laughter|url=http://universe.byu.edu/2014/06/23/matt-meese-living-a-life-of-laughter/|website=universe.byu.edu|publisher=The Universe}} ==Studio C== It was during his membership of BYU's on-campus sketch comedy group, ''[[Divine Comedy (BYU)|Divine Comedy]]'' that Meese and other original members of ''[[Studio C]]'' first conceived the idea for the show. The show was not considered by BYUtv until Meese personally met with content director Jared Shores, his best friend, and pitched him the idea. Meese is acknowledged as one of the creators of ''Studio C'' and the show's head writer.{{cite web|last1=Brady|first1=Meagan|title=Matt Meese|url=http://mormonartist.net/interviews/matt-meese/|website=mormonartist.net}} Matt is known for many roles in his sketch comedy. Meese's most well-known role is as [[Scott Sterling (fictional)|Scott Sterling]],{{cite web|last1=Joseph|first1=Andrew|title=Meet Scott Sterling, that guy whose face keeps getting pummeled in delightful videos|url=http://ftw.usatoday.com/2016/03/scott-sterling-matt-meese-volleyball-face-video|website=ftw.usatoday.com}} an unlucky soccer and volleyball player who continually receives blows to the head and by doing so ultimately helps his team to victory. In terms of views, the Sterling series are the most successful sketches of Studio C,{{cite web|last1=Petersen|first1=Sarah|title=50 million views: Behind the scenes of the viral video from 'Studio C'|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/865616389/10-million-views-in-10-days-Behind-the-scenes-of-the-viral-video-from-Studio-C.html?pg=all|website=deseretnews.com|accessdate=20 July 2016}}{{cite web|last1=Williams|first1=Lindsey|title=New Scott Sterling sketch from ‘Studio C’ making national, international headlines|url=http://www.deseretnews.com/article/865651252/New-Scott-Sterling-sketch-from-6Studio-C7-making-national-international-headlines.html?pg=all|website=deseretnews.com|accessdate=20 July 2016}} being the only Studio C videos to exceed 30 million views on YouTube.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/user/BYUTelevision/videos?flow=grid&sort=p&view=0|website=youtube.com|accessdate=20 July 2016}} As confirmed in August 2018, while Studio C will have a 10th season, he and the other 9 original cast members are leaving after the 9th season to create and star in a new family-comedy show together. After sharing the news, he also expressed that he would like to do future guest spots for the show when the opportunity arises. ==Personal life== Meese is [[colorblind]].{{cite web|url=http://www.ldsliving.com/The-Ultimate-Guide-to-Studio-C-Everything-You-Wanted-to-Know-About-the-Cast-and-the-Show/s/82954|title=The Ultimate Guide to Studio C: Everything You Wanted to Know About the Cast and the Show|date=14 September 2016|publisher=}} ==Filmography== {|class="wikitable sortable" |- ! Year ! Title ! Role ! Notes |- |- |2008 |''Unhinged'' |Right |Short |- |2012 |''Abandoned in Space'' |Calvin |Short |- |2012–2019 |''[[Studio C]]'' |Himself/[[Scott Sterling (fictional)|Scott Sterling]]/Various Others |Main Cast (Season 1-9)
Serves also as head writer and co-creator |- |2014 |''[[Saints and Soldiers: The Void]]'' |Daniel Barlow |Movie |- |2016 |''Jester'Z Improv Comedy Live'' |Himself/Various |DVD Special |- | rowspan="2" |2017 |''[[Conan (talk show)|Conan]]'' |Himself- ''Studio C'' |1 episode |- | ''Frankly Faraci'' |Himself |1 episode |- |2018 |''The Laughter Life'' |Himself |Documentary about ''Studio C'' |} ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * {{IMDb name|3277887}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Meese, Matt}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:1983 births]] [[Category:People with color blindness]]
